tweet: We must harness the same imagination FDR demonstrated a century ago. Let’s put many tens of thousands of unemployed folks to work contact tracing and helping people isolate safely. That's what @SenWarren's & my Coronavirus Containment Corps is all about. https://t.co/LZhCkInvzH

And if you include another 9.8 million workers who also want jobs but who’ve not looked in the past 12 months, you get a grand total of 27.3% Americans unemployed. Over ¼ of Americans unable to work to their capacity. This is a crisis of the first order.
But the “true” unemployment rate – including workers who are “discouraged”, “marginally attached” or “part-time-of-necessity” – jumped from 9.0% to 22.8%. Simply stunning.

April 2020 will go down in history as the steepest increase in unemployment in the history of the United States – even including the Great Depression. The “official” unemployment rocketed to 14.7% from 4.4% in March.
